intro: Endiandra solomonensis, commonly known as Solomon's endiandra, is a tropical tree native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are typically followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
